item.title: Overgrown trees and bushes damaging private property, 1st June
item.description:
Number 1 Compton Close Churchdown Gloucester Gl3 1NY. The trees used to get felled regularly haven’t been done for a longtime. The last time these were left they collapsed into our garden. The trees are causing our fence to bow along with the overgrown bushes the other side. It’s also taking out natural light.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Compton Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disabled access on pavement removed, 1st June
item.description:
The newly created Co Op on Pilley Lane has removed disabled access from the pavement. As you'll see from the attached photographs, the dropped kerb has been entirely removed meaning that anyone in a wheelchair or on a mobility scooter is pushed into the road as they won't be able to navigate it. Please can this be sorted as a matter of urgency; people are already being forced into the road by blocked pavements. When the Co op opens the traffic problems experienced on Leckhampton Road will be transferred here - there has been nothing put in the plans to alleviate these - and it is going to make the road even more dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Pilley Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inadequate street name signage, 31st May
item.description:
I have marked on the map where Stoke Road becomes Stoke Orchard Road, according to most maps and most information.The stretch between the by pass (A435) roundabout and my marker is the extent of Stoke Orchard Road. After my marker, the road, continuing westwards, is Stoke Road. Going north then immediately west from my marker is also Stoke Road. Spitfire Homes, on their website and in their correspondence, gives the address of their Fairmont site as Stoke Orchard Rd. I believe this is incorrect. It is likely that the new residents have all been given the wrong address. Recently, Fitzgerald Civil Engineering Contractors sent me a letter headed "S278 Highway Works - Stoke Orchard Road, Bishop's Cleeve". This warned me that Stoke Orchard Road would be closed to carry out carriageway surfacing works on Thursday 29th May and Friday 30th May, the closure times being from 8pm to 6am. On the Thursday I took care to be home before 8pm so I would not be blocked out or required to make a detour, as I live on Whitefields Road. I need not have worried because Stoke Orchard Road was not affected at all, and the contractors were busy setting up a road block further west, on Stoke Road. However, I was concerned that false information had been sent out which could have misled me and other travellers. Can you please confirm the street names in this area. Can you please provide street signs to show clearly which is Stoke Orchard Road and which is Stoke Road. Can you kindly instruct Spitfire Homes and all their contractors as to the street names where they are working.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
